intro: Microseris oligantha, commonly known as the narrowleaf biscuitroot, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many economically important plants such as cabbage and mustard. The plant is characterized by its basal rosette of narrow, gray-green leaves and produces small, yellow flowers in late spring. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and open habitats. Microseris oligantha is an herbaceous perennial that plays a role in stabilizing soils and supporting local pollinator populations.
